revised_title: Improved Method of Ultra-Violet Anomalous Rotary Dispersion of Sodium Tartrate
tldr: The authors developed an improved method for measuring ultra-violet polarimetric measurements using a triple-field polarimeter and a quartz-calcite spectrograph. They applied this method to study the anomalous rotary dispersion of sodium tartrate in the ultra-violet region, finding that the salt's rotatory dispersion is likely complex and deviates from Biot's Law.
